title: Welcome to the Summer School on Advanced Technologies for Knowledge Intensive Networked Organizations 2010 - Aachen

author: Peter Laing, FIR - Research Institute for Operations Management, RWTH Aachen University

segmentation: For me to open the summer school for this week, unfortunately.
Some of the speakers are still missing, but nevertheless we will start right now because we're going to stuff tough.
Schedule some of the speakers and I think also students.
They're stuck in Brussels.
There is today a strike, and so there's no possibility to get by rail here talking, so there is a problem.
We will overcome this problem.
We will take it will take hopefully a rental car and we will expect the rest of the speakers by this afternoon here now.
Well, my name is Peter Peter Lang.
I'm here the head of the Department for Information Management.
I'm here right now on behalf of Professor Steve, he was announced to give the welcome here, but unfortunately he is for meeting for research.
Industrial research associations where he has to join, but he wants to send me his regrets that he cannot make so welcome here but for me it is a great honor and I would like to give you a brief.
Introduction to.
Fr, I do not think that everyone of you knows who or what FIR really is.
For that I will take a couple of minutes and yeah afterwards.

OK. Was first time to Germany?
OK, so your first time not to happen.
Well, if I are belongs to R WTH University, it is a really old Technical University here now and it was founded in 1870.
So more than 140 years old we do have right now more than 30,000 students and more than five cells and students are working or doing their studies in mechanical engineering.
So that's where we belong.
We belong directly to.
FIR itself was founded in 1954.
We do have 45 researchers in three different departments.
I will show you later on and.
If it were headcount, including students and secretary, and whatever, we will count up to more than 140 employees and we are connected to really well to WS at all.
It is the biggest Institute here in our clinic.
Has more than 600 employees, was founded in 1996, so it's even older.
And we are linked to WS at a or with our scientific Directorate is Professor Xu is really well known here, and he is sharing the Institute for Production Engineering.
So that is the reason why we are linked to WSL and Professor Xu.
He's also director of Fraunhofer Institute for Production Technologies, and for that reason we are also linked to Fraunhofer IPT.
And we all were collaborating quite well.

What each others and what we are doing is this is a big brand with bandwidth of competencies we have in these institutes and the research topics are disjunctive and for that reason there is no competition between these institutes working together.
So that is a network we are in.
And all coming back to FDR so you can see you know.
First Professor Xu, who is the scientific director, so is for us.
So link to the other Institute.

Professor fish you see executive director, and he was unfortunately not here and I'm here now, on his behalf, and we have got three different departments at if you are first, it is production management.
There are focusing on auto management, logistics management and many on supply chain design.
What's they also have is ERP Innovation lab, and as far as I know you will have.
Introduction to this European nation level is pretty nice.
That is, think it is somehow unique in Germany and Europe.
Second Department is service management.
It is focusing on industrial services services.
We've got a specific complexity and two to overcome this complexity.
They've got a different approaches in service engineering, so doing it on a methodical way to engineer new services.
Complex viruses.
Uh, which lean services it's Ward so performance of services and they do have a so called service Science innovation lab and.
You will also get an introduction to this lab 2 and 30.
Partner is Department information management.
It's the Department I am heading.
We do have a strong focus on the logistics of information and that's what we are mainly doing in this project active.
Second, focuses on the deployment of new and innovative information and communication technologies such as RFID auto ID, lots of enterprises.

They do not know how they can diploid these new technologies and we support supporting the enterprises to match the potentials of these new technologies to the needs and the processors of the enterprises.
That's what we're doing, and we are.
Now setting up a smart object innovation lab so we just can give you on this lab presentation, but the lab is not yet opened.
There will be an opening next year on the 8th of February and everyone here is of course invited for that event.
Yeah, that's.
If they are in a nutshell, so mainly we're doing research.
So it's an edited Institute.
We are funded by doing projects, projects that would be funded mainly by European Union and also buy a BMW I that is a German ministry for Economics and Technology.
We are focusing as an example on RFID business, process management, knowledge management, all these aspects.
We do have addressing different industrious, but we have got.
As specific focus on, of course.
On production, yes, but also on logistics and what is quite new IT is about alternative energy.
And that's what we're doing in projects, and one of the.
Yeah, the biggest projects will be right of beyond of course active and active will be now introduced by Paul.
Afterwards is a smart Watson Smart builds both our lighthouse projects here in Germany, where we will set up a new approach for a new energy system where electricity is becoming smart.
We are.
We will set up demand side management, portfolio management and so on.
Projects with an overall budget of about 40 million euros and I think we are quite far ahead than other initiatives in Europe and would like to go in further on in this direction.
I want a European number because what we see is that all the solutions we have been developed here in Germany are quite well, but I think they can be transferred somehow to other countries.
Yeah, that's what we're doing right now so.
So if I are organization doing research and projects.
This is the next step.
What is our vision?
So yesterday research, for example it was.
Projects were running quite long.

So some years ago it was before my time, but for its research project we're running more than five years, so it is quite a long time and we are addressing a very very narrow solution space, and it was some years ago it was you had to know where to find information where it is written.
So that was some years ago.
So today.
Things have quite changed significantly.
Solution space is is broaden.
Time for the project is still quite long.
So many projects are lasting more than three years, still very long, longer than the industry wants, and what you need.
Today you need to know who is knowing what, so this being being in networks.
So what is normal or vision?
Or vision is to with to reduce time for useful solutions, open the solution space by a new approach we call it R WHR campus.
I will introduce what exactly that is and well then you have to know where knowledge is being created.
So once you have a melting point for knowledge and what what that could be.
We can see here.
In our home, so we will set up campus project.
Campus Project is is really really big.
It is about we're talking about.
If the investment of two billion euros.
It's quite a lot and RWH University will first develop its business model.
What does it mean?
But now students they can subscribe to the University and getting and hopefully good idea scientific education.
But the next step is that also enterprises can go to often doing research with us.
Here in our home and having the stuff here also in our home.
So that is the approach and the two billion euros are coming not from the government.
They're coming from investors, and these enterprises.
That's what you're going and.

At the beginning it is like biomedical engineering photonics.
Heavyduty off Hwy.
Powertrain or what?
Could that be?
It is what the rings of the windmills for example.

ERP innovation lab.

Smart Objects Innovation lab and service science innovation and they are already part of this campus class logistics and right now the buildings therefore being constructed and we assume that we can move with whole F IR to this cluster here in our King is very close by.
We expect that we can move.
Mid with summer of 2012.
So later on we have got bought there about 15 clusters are being defined and they will start later on to the end.

So what are the requirements for one cluster?
So this is a an overview of what would be constructed.

OK, it is very close by maybe can show later on a map of our Homeric where exactly this it is about the distance from your support.

That is, many requirement is strong and acceptance from industrial partners because they should.
They have to invest here.
They have to spend money on research and the idea is that they are coming here to our home doing research with us and it is not just within working.
The partners within one project, because usually we've got one project it starts.
You have good time, then the research the projects coming coming to an end and the partners and then getting a losing each other and to avoid set things.
That is quite good approach.
Well until the end.
It's a starting cluster, will encompass.
10,000 square meters and more than 300 deployed employees that as a minimum requirements for a cluster.
So where can you meet us?

OK honey, you have to rest information.

It will be in June or early in June.

Yes, we can meet us also.
